page.title: 05EDUCATION
page.content: children had gone to Smithfield. Children came from a wide area and enrolment fluctuated considerably peaking at 120 with the post war occupation of the RAF camps. The original building is now a house and a new school was opened in 1962. It has two classrooms, hall and large grounds with a staff of 22 including the headteacher supported by a helper, a cleaner in charge, a dinner lady and secretarial help in the morning. Due to the slump in the birthrate there are now only 28 children on the roll and the school is being reviewed with a possibility of closure. The children would again go to Smithfield. The school works closely with the small schools at Hatton, Wolverton, BAddesley, Clinton, Wroxall and Wolverton
